document_data.name: House of Sun and Earth
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Sun and Earth''' was a temple dedicated to the worship of both [[Chauntea]] and [[Lathander]] in the town of [[Woody Glen]].{{Cite dungeon/67/Witches' Brew|15}}
document_data.Structure: This temple was the largest structure in Woody Glen and had a graveyard attached to it.{{Cite dungeon/67/Witches' Brew|12}}
document_data.Activities: This temple provided weekly religious services to the inhabitants of Woody Glen. In addition, it offered healing for the injured and sick. They offered [[holy water]] for free to [[good]]-[[alignment|aligned]] [[priest]]s, but charged everyone else a price of 30 [[gold piece]]s per [[vial]].
document_data.Inhabitants: In the 14{{th}} century [[DR]] the House of Sun and Earth had several acolytes, with the high priest of the temple being [[Turghan|Father Turghan]].{{Cite dungeon/67/Witches' Brew|12,15}}
document_data.Reputation: Many of the farmers in Woody Glen attributed their successful harvests to the influence of the House of Sun and Earth.
document_data.History: In the late 14{{th}} century DR, Woody Glen fell victim to a number of [[magic]]al mishaps perpetrated by the [[witch]] [[Morda]]. Father Turghan and his acolytes prayed to their temple's two [[deities]], but received no enlightening visions. A group of [[adventurer]]s approached the Father about these mishaps, but knowing only that dark forces must be at work Turghan suggested they investigate the nearby abandoned [[Sebastian Manor]].{{Cite dungeon/67/Witches' Brew|19}}
